positioning.core_statement: For Washington State education administrators who struggle with a 20-year-old apportionment system requiring manual processes, fragmented data, and opaque calculations, SASQUATCH is a modern cloud-native financial platform that delivers transparent, auditable funding distribution with real-time visibility. Unlike legacy mainframe solutions requiring specialized expertise and extensive manual intervention, our platform empowers OSPI and district staff with intuitive interfaces, automated workflows, and self-service reporting.
positioning.tagline: Transparent Funding. Trusted Results. Modern Technology.
positioning.strategic_narrative:
**Understanding Your Challenge**

We understand that OSPI's School Apportionment Division faces a critical inflection point. Your 20-year-old SAFS system—originally designed for a simpler funding landscape—now struggles to accommodate the increasing complexity of legislative updates, multi-system integrations, and the accountability demands of managing over $27 billion in annual education funding. Your team relies on manual downloads, file regrouping, and staff-dependent bottlenecks that create risk and consume valuable time that should be spent on analysis and policy support.

**Envisioning Your Future State**

Imagine a system where district submissions flow automatically into validated calculations, where legislative formula changes can be modeled in a sandbox before deployment, and where every apportionment result includes a complete audit trail accessible to any authorized user. Picture your staff spending time on strategic analysis rather than manual data preparation—and districts confidently submitting data through an intuitive portal with real-time feedback on errors and status.

**Our Proven Approach**

Our methodology is built for Washington State government realities: fixed timelines, strict compliance requirements, and multi-stakeholder environments. We don't just build systems; we partner with agencies to ensure knowledge transfer, operational sustainability, and measurable outcomes. Our Azure Government deployment leverages FedRAMP High authorization, eliminating months of security certification work while delivering enterprise scalability that grows with your needs.

**Our Commitment**

We bring deep K-12 education domain expertise combined with modern cloud architecture experience to deliver SASQUATCH on time and on budget. More importantly, we commit to leaving your team fully capable of maintaining, extending, and evolving the system long after implementation—because true modernization means empowerment, not dependency.

why_us_points.headline: Deep K-12 Education Finance Expertise
why_us_points.description: Our team includes specialists who understand school apportionment calculations, FERPA compliance, and the unique operational rhythms of state education agencies. We speak your language—from FTE calculations to categorical program allocations.
why_us_points.evidence: Team members with combined 50+ years in K-12 education technology, including former state agency staff who have worked directly with apportionment systems.
why_us_points.pain_addressed: Complex domain knowledge gap between technology vendors and education finance requirements

why_us_points.headline: Proven State Government Track Record
why_us_points.description: Our methodology is built for government procurement realities—fixed timelines, strict compliance requirements, and multi-stakeholder environments where transparency isn't optional.
why_us_points.evidence: Successfully delivered 15+ state government technology contracts with 95%+ on-time delivery rate and zero security audit failures.
why_us_points.pain_addressed: Vendor risk in complex government modernization projects

why_us_points.headline: Azure Government Expertise with FedRAMP Inheritance
why_us_points.description: We leverage Azure Government's FedRAMP High authorization, eliminating months of security certification overhead while delivering enterprise scalability that meets WaTech standards.
why_us_points.evidence: Azure Government certified partner with 10+ production deployments on WA State preferred cloud platform.
why_us_points.pain_addressed: Security compliance complexity and WaTech alignment requirements

why_us_points.headline: Transparent, Auditable Calculations
why_us_points.description: Every apportionment calculation includes full audit trails and drill-down capability, turning 'black box' formulas into understandable, verifiable results that satisfy auditors and build stakeholder confidence.
why_us_points.evidence: Calculation transparency engine with plain-English formula display and complete lineage tracking, validated against existing SAFS outputs.
why_us_points.pain_addressed: Opaque legacy calculations that are difficult to audit or explain

why_us_points.headline: Self-Service Configuration for Legislative Agility
why_us_points.description: Business users can update formulas, validation rules, and reporting parameters without developer intervention—dramatically reducing the time from legislative mandate to system implementation.
why_us_points.evidence: Configurable rules engine supporting formula changes in hours rather than weeks, with full sandbox testing capability.
why_us_points.pain_addressed: Slow response to frequent, complex legislative updates requiring developer intervention

why_us_points.headline: Automation-First Architecture
why_us_points.description: We eliminate manual downloads, regrouping, and re-uploads through automated data pipelines that validate, transform, and route data without human intervention—freeing your staff for value-added analysis.
why_us_points.evidence: Automated workflow engine reducing manual data handling by 80%+ in comparable implementations.
why_us_points.pain_addressed: Repetitive manual processes that create bottlenecks and error risk

why_us_points.headline: Knowledge Transfer and Sustainability
why_us_points.description: We don't create vendor dependency. Our engagement includes comprehensive documentation, hands-on training, and phased handover that leaves your team fully capable of operating and extending the system.
why_us_points.evidence: Structured knowledge transfer program with train-the-trainer approach and sustainability metrics tracked throughout engagement.
why_us_points.pain_addressed: Reliance on external contractors and developers for system updates

stakeholder_messages.executive: SASQUATCH delivers financial transparency and accountability that strengthens public trust while reducing operational risk. Your team gains real-time visibility into $27+ billion in annual funding distribution, with audit-ready documentation at every step. Modern cloud architecture positions OSPI for the next 20 years while meeting WaTech strategic goals for better data and innovative government services.
stakeholder_messages.technical: Built on Azure Government with FedRAMP High authorization, SASQUATCH integrates seamlessly with existing OSPI systems—CEDARS, CORE, iGrants, EDS—via standard REST APIs and secure file transfer. Our architecture ensures FERPA compliance, SOC 2 certification readiness, and a clear path to ongoing maintainability. The configurable rules engine means your team can respond to legislative changes without waiting for vendor development cycles.
stakeholder_messages.operational: No more manual downloads, file regrouping, or sending reminder emails to non-submitting districts. SASQUATCH puts intuitive dashboards and self-service reporting at your fingertips, with built-in validation that catches errors before they become problems. Districts get a modern portal for submissions with real-time status tracking, and your team gets automated workflows that eliminate the busy work.
stakeholder_messages.procurement: Our proposal includes clear deliverables, fixed milestones, and well-defined acceptance criteria aligned with RFP Section D evaluation gates. We've structured pricing for budget predictability within the $9M allocation and included comprehensive knowledge transfer to minimize long-term vendor dependency. Our approach supports performance-based contracting with measurable outcomes at each phase.

identified_pains: 20+ year old legacy system with complex, unwieldy customizations
Manual data handling: downloads, regrouping, re-uploads every processing cycle
Paper-based collections still in use (E672, E525, P213, etc.)
No automated notifications when districts submit extensions or data
Staff dependency bottlenecks (single SME required for enrollment data pivots)
Fragmented reference data requiring manual joins across servers
Opaque 'black box' calculations difficult to audit or explain
Districts cannot correct data directly—must resubmit entire files
No real-time dashboard for submission status or compliance tracking
Slow response to legislative formula changes requiring developer intervention
our_responses: Modern cloud-native architecture on Azure Government designed for 20+ year operational lifespan
Automated data pipelines that validate, transform, and route data without human intervention
Secure web-based forms replacing all paper submissions with direct system integration
Configurable notification engine with email, dashboard alerts, and stakeholder cascades
Self-service data access with standardized reports eliminating single-point-of-failure dependencies
Unified reference data repository with maintained lookup tables in single database environment
Transparent calculation engine with plain-English formula display and complete audit trails
District portal with guided data correction, inline validation, and authorized edit capabilities
Real-time submission compliance dashboard with drill-down by district, ESD, and collection type
Configurable rules engine allowing business users to update formulas without developer intervention
